titleStmt.title: Description of Library Company, 15: Book of Hours, fragment
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a twenty-three folio fragment of a fifteenth-century Book of Hours produced in Northern France. It contains fragments of the Seven Penitential Psalms, Hours of the Cross, Hours of the Holy Spirit, and Litany. The first five folios, all singletons, are severely and irregularly trimmed. Apart from three conjoined bifolia, the book consists of bound singletons. The manuscript was bequeathed to the Loganian Library (later the Library Company of Philadelphia) by William Mackenzie.

msItem.title: Seven Penitential Psalms, first page only
Hours of the Cross, Matins, first page only
Hours of the Cross, end only, and Hours of the Holy Spirit, first page only
Hours of the Holy Spirit, fragment
Hours of the Holy Spirit, fragment

supportDesc.extent: ii+23+ii; 133 x 91 mm bound to 137 x 91 mm

layoutDesc.layout: One column of fifteen lines, ruled in red; written area: 78 x 55 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Inside front coverBookplate, William Mackenzie bequest to the Loganian Library

binding.p: Nineteenth-century boards; gilt "M.S." and Library Company labels on spine

history.provenance: William Mackenzie, Philadelphia; bequeathed to the Loganian Library in 1828, later the Library Company of Philadelphia, according to the Loganian accession book
